description.narrative: Niue is a self governing territory of New Zealand with a population of approximately 1200 people. Australia's development assistance to Niue consists of annual contributions to the Niue International Trust Fund and the provision of technical assistance through the Pacific Technical Assistance Mechanism (PACTAM). Funding under this initiative focuses on improving basic education infrastructure. Australia has agreed to support construction of new primary school and early childhood education buildings on the site proposed by Government of Niue, and to delegate the construction stage to the Government of New Zealand to manage on behalf of AusAID (delegated cooperation). The total value of this initiative is $4.8 million over three years, starting 2011-12.
